alert.note: Alert for La Salle (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 17 at 7:51PM CST until further notice by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Illinois... Illinois River at Ottawa affecting La Salle County. For the Illinois River (Upper)...including Ottawa...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is expected due to a combination of elevated river levels and river ice. * WHERE...Illinois River from Heritage Harbor east of Ottawa downstream to Starved Rock Lock and Dam, including the Ottawa gauge. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...Flooding of low-lying overbank areas near Starved Rock State Park, Naplate, and Ottawa is likely. Flooding of park areas and low-lying roadways is possible in Ottawa, and flooding of trails is possible at Starved Rock State Park. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 462.2 feet. - Forecast...River levels are expected to remain at near bankfull for the next several days. - Flood stage is 463.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: An ice jam is affecting water levels in this area. River forecasts during ice jams are less certain due to many complicated factors. Significant river ice cover can cause large water level fluctuations and flooding with little advanced notice. River ice may also cause gauge observations to be inaccurate. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday afternoon at 200 PM CST.
